properties.title: Properties
properties.properties_tooltip: The various fields associated with each image
properties.linked_property_tooltip: Property linked to an image instance, for more information read the documentation on instances
properties.hidden_property_tooltip: This property is not visible in this mode because it is linked to an image instance

computed.title: Panoptic Properties
computed.2_tooltip: Unique signature, two perfectly identical images will have the same sha1
computed.3_tooltip: Average signature, two visually very similar images will have the same ahash
computed.7_tooltip: Path of the image on disk

menu.search_tooltip: Search for images matching the text using the CLIP template
menu.image_mode_tooltip: Switch between instance and image modes, in image mode, only properties common to all instances of an image will be displayed.

sort.title: Sort:
sort.group_order_nb_tooltip: Sort groups by number of images

recommand.title: Image suggestions
recommand.tooltip: Images considered to be visually and/or semantically related

view.group_clusters_tooltip: Uses a machine learning algorithm (Kmeans) to propose temporary groups by image similarity. See the documentation on clusters for more information.
view.cluster_score_tooltip: Cluster consistency score. See cluster documentation for more information
view.instances_tooltip: Number of instances of this image

graph-view.info: Click on the legend to show images of all datapoints

fs.images: Select the folder you want to add images from
fs.import: Select the project folder to import
fs.create: Where should project folder be created ?

image.similar_images_tooltip: Images considered to be visually and/or semantically close to the current image using the KDTree algorithm and image vectors
image.unique_properties_tooltip: Display properties related to instances of this image
image.similarity_filter_tooltip: The minimum similarity percentage that images displayed here must have. For more information, see the documentation on the similarity score.
image.toggle_property_tooltip: Show / Hide this property in the 'Similar images' view
image.fill_property_tooltip: Tag all similar images with the value of this property

properties.title: New property
properties.string_tooltip: Text, e.g. tweet content, image description
properties.number_tooltip: Numbers, e.g. the number of likes on twitter, the width of a table
properties.tag_tooltip: A single label chosen from a list, e.g. an image category, a location, a source
properties.multi_tags_tooltip: Like a label but with the possibility of assigning several at the same time
properties.url_tooltip: A clickable URL, e.g. the link to the source of an image
properties.date_tooltip: A date in dd / mm / yyyy format
properties.color_tooltip: A simple colored square to categorize without assigning a label

tagging.title: Properties
tagging.erase_tooltip: Erase this field for whole selection

tutorial.step-1: Welcome to Panoptic, you don't have any projects at the moment.
tutorial.step-2: Click here to create a new project.
tutorial.step-3: Select here the folder where Panoptic data will be stored (note: this is not the folder where the images come from).
tutorial.step-3a: Choose the folder to create the project in and confirm.
tutorial.step-3b: Enter a project name and click to finalize and create the project.
tutorial.step-4: You don't have any images at the moment, click here to add an image folder.
tutorial.step-4b: Choose your image folder and click here to confirm.
tutorial.step-5: Images are imported here, and calculations are performed, this may take some time.
tutorial.step-6: Before calculations are complete, you can create a property. Properties are used to create annotations.
tutorial.step-7: You need to choose the property type, for this example choose Label type, you can hover over the other types for more information.
tutorial.step-8: Also enter a name, for example 'category' and confirm.
tutorial.step-9: The property now appears under all images with the value 'None', click on it to edit this value, and enter a keyword, for example 'test'.
tutorial.step-10: So you have just assigned the label 'test' to this image. Besides annotations, properties allow filtering, grouping, and sorting of images.
tutorial.step-11: You can now group images by pressing '+' and selecting 'category'. This will create two groups of images 'category: undefined' and 'category: test'.
tutorial.step-12: If you assign the value 'test' to another image, it will automatically be moved to the 'category: test' group.
tutorial.step-13: Hover over an image in the 'category: undefined' group and click on the selection icon in the top left corner.
tutorial.step-13a: Select multiple images in the same way, or hold SHIFT and click the selection icon of another image to select all images between them.
tutorial.step-13b: You can now assign a value to multiple images at once, for example the value 'test2' which will create a new group of images; 'category: test2'.
tutorial.step-14: Click 'category' again to remove grouping. Filters and sorts work in the same way.
tutorial.step-14b: Click here to create a new tab, filters, groups, and sorts are specific to each tab and allow easy switching between sub-corpora.
tutorial.step-15: Once calculations are complete, you can use Panoptic's machine learning features. For example, to create automatic groups.
tutorial.step-16: Click on an image to open it in full size, similar images to this image are displayed on the side.
tutorial.step-17: Find more detailed tutorials on the CERES website: https://ceres.sorbonne-universite.fr/outils/panoptic
